message.content:
<<<api>>>: String.getBytes
<<<code>>>: ArrayList<String> sql;
int res;
FileSQLCommandManager fichero = null;
try {
    if (pass == null)
        conectar(conn);
    else
        conectar(conn, pass);
    Statement st = null;
    st = conn.createStatement();
    st.executeUpdate("SET FOREIGN_KEY_CHECKS=0");
    PreparedStatement stConstraints = null;
    String cadenaSQL = null;
    String cadenaSQLConstraints = null;
    String cadenaConstraints;
    ResultSet rs;
    boolean ejecutar = false;
    fichero = new FileSQLCommandManager(fic);
    fichero.open();
    sql = fichero.read();
    cadenaSQL = "";
    for (int i = 0; i < sql.size(); i++) {
        cadenaSQL = sql.get(i);
        ejecutar = true;
        if (ejecutar) {
            st = null;
            st = conn.createStatement();
            byte[] bytes = cadenaSQL.getBytes("UTF-8");
            res = st.executeUpdate(new String(bytes, "UTF-8"));
            if (res == Statement.EXECUTE_FAILED) {
                System.out.println("HA FALLADO LA CONSULTA " + cadenaSQL);
            }
        }
    }
    st.executeUpdate("SET FOREIGN_KEY_CHECKS=1");
    st.close();
    fichero.close();
    commit();
    desconectar();
    fichero = null;
    return true;
} catch (Exception ex) {
    ex.printStackTrace();
    rollback();
    desconectar();
    return false;
}
<<<explanation>>>: The issue you are facing might be related to encoding. The executeUpdate() method expects a String parameter, but the content of the ArrayList might contain characters that are not supported by the default encoding. To ensure that the content is properly encoded, you can use the getBytes() method of the String class to convert the String to a byte array using a specific encoding (in this case, "UTF-8"). Then, you can create a new String object using the byte array and the same encoding. This ensures that the content is properly encoded before executing the query.

prompt:
Please answer my code questions using the given API following this format: <<<api>>>: $API
<<<code>>>: $CODE
<<<explanation>>>: $EXPLANATION.
Question: How can I calculate the sum of an array in Java?
Please using this api: Arrays.stream.
Answer:<<<api>>>: Arrays.stream
<<<code>>>: int[] array = {1, 2, 3, 4, 5};
int sum = Arrays.stream(array).sum();
<<<explanation>>>: The sum() method of the IntStream class returns the sum of elements in this stream. This is a special case of a reduction. This is a terminal operation.
Question: MySQL restoration from Java stops suddenly without any message and hangs: :I'm trying to restore a MySQL database from a file generated with mysqldump.I do it with an ArrayList that contains each query of the restoration plan and I execute each one of them with a Statement.But sometimes, it stops on some point of the proccess (it can be different on different executions). It doesn't show any error message; it just hangs (when this happens, I need to restart the Mysql service).This is the code of the restoration:    ArrayList<String> sql;    int res;    FileSQLCommandManager fichero = null;    try {        if (pass == null)            conectar(conn);        else            conectar(conn, pass);        Statement st = null;        st = conn.createStatement();             st.executeUpdate("SET FOREIGN_KEY_CHECKS=0");        PreparedStatement stConstraints = null;        String cadenaSQL = null;        String cadenaSQLConstraints = null;        String cadenaConstraints;        ResultSet rs;        boolean ejecutar = false;        fichero = new FileSQLCommandManager(fic);        fichero.open();        sql = fichero.read();        cadenaSQL = "";        for (int i = 0; i < sql.size(); i++) {            cadenaSQL = sql.get(i);            ejecutar = true;            if (ejecutar) {                                    st = null;                st = conn.createStatement();                res = st.executeUpdate(cadenaSQL);                if (res == Statement.EXECUTE_FAILED) {                    System.out.println("HA FALLADO LA CONSULTA " + cadenaSQL);                }            }        }                st.executeUpdate("SET FOREIGN_KEY_CHECKS=1");                st.close();        fichero.close();        commit();        desconectar();        fichero = null;        return true;    } catch (Exception ex) {        ex.printStackTrace();        rollback();        desconectar();        return false;    }}FileSQLCommandManager is a class that fills the ArrayList. This works, the ArrayList content is all right. It stops on executeUpdate of any query (not always, sometimes it works without problems WITH THE SAME SQL FILE).First I disable the foreign key checks because it can drop a table with a reference (the order of recreation of tables is set by the SQL dump).Any hint?Thank's; I'm getting mad with this :(
